item.title: 英国石油公司（BP）、壳牌石油公司（Shell）和美国石油天然气公司（EOG）在特立尼达石油天然气拍卖会上争夺耕地面积
item.description: 特立尼达和多巴哥 2023 年浅水区拍卖于周一结束，共收到来自英国石油公司（BP）、壳牌石油公司（Shell）和美国页岩油生产商 EOG Resources 的六份标书，竞拍四个油气勘探区块。【原文：Trinidad and Tobago received six bids from BP , Shell and US shale producer EOG Resources on four blocks to explore for oil and gas as its 2023 shallow water auction closed on Monday.】

item.title: 墨西哥航空公司暂时中止墨西哥城-基多航线
item.description: 墨西哥航空公司周一表示，将暂时中止墨西哥城至厄瓜多尔首都基多的航线。【原文：Mexican carrier Aeromexico is temporarily suspending its route from Mexico City to the Ecuadorean capital of Quito, the airline said on Monday.】

item.title: 巴西央行行长称巴西通胀预期将逐步改善
item.description: 巴西央行行长罗伯托-坎波斯-内托（Roberto Campos Neto）周一表示，决策者认为通胀预期应随着时间的推移趋于稳定和改善，而最近他又提到了对通胀预期偏离官方目标的担忧。【原文：Brazil's central bank chief Roberto Campos Neto said on Monday that policymakers believe inflation expectations should stabilize and improve over time, after recently citing concerns about them deviating from the official target.】

item.title: Meta 为 CrowdTangle 添加安全功能，以消除欧盟的担忧
item.description: Meta Platforms 为其错误信息跟踪工具 CrowdTangle 增加了安全功能，以便在欧洲议会选举期间使用，试图消除欧盟的担忧，因为欧盟上个月曾就其逐步淘汰该工具的决定所产生的影响展开调查。【原文：Meta Platforms has added safety features to its misinformation tracking tool CrowdTangle for use during European Parliament elections in an attempt to allay EU concerns that triggered an investigation last month into the impact of its decision to phase out the tool.】

item.title: Vulcan 拒绝接受墨西哥对其投资的 "非法征用
item.description: 美国建筑公司 Vulcan Materials 周一拒绝接受其认为是对其在墨西哥投资的 "非法征用"，并表示对与墨西哥政府谈判解决问题持开放态度。【原文：U.S. construction company Vulcan Materials on Monday rejected what it considers the "illegal expropriation" of its investments in Mexico and said it remains open to a negotiated solution with the Mexican government.】

item.title: 独家报道消息人士称，亚马逊正与意大利洽谈投资数十亿欧元的云计算计划
item.description: 四位熟悉内情的人士透露，亚马逊计算部门AWS正在与意大利谈判，计划投资数十亿欧元扩大在该国的数据中心业务，这也是这家科技巨头在欧洲推广云计算业务的努力之一。【原文：Amazon's computing unit AWS is in talks with Italy to invest billions of euros in the expansion of its data centre business in the country as part of the tech giant's effort to boost its cloud offer in Europe, four people familiar with the matter said.】

item.title: 独家报道消息称诺基亚将向葡萄牙 MEO 公司提供 5G 无线设备
item.description: 据诺基亚内部博文和两位熟悉内情的消息人士透露，诺基亚将赢得一份向葡萄牙电信运营商 MEO 供应 5G 无线电设备的合同。【原文：Nokia is set to win a contract to supply 5G radio equipment to Portuguese telecoms operator MEO, according to an internal Nokia blog post and two sources familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 消息人士称，意大利贝纳通公司因亏损加剧而计划重组
item.description: 意大利贝纳通家族正准备解决其同名服装零售商日益严重的亏损问题，包括与首席执行官马西莫-雷农（Massimo Renon）在四年后分道扬镳。【原文：Italy's Benetton family is readying plans to address mounting losses at its eponymous clothing retailer, including parting ways with CEO Massimo Renon after four years, two people close to the group said on Monday.】

item.title: 巴西 Gol 公司称破产退出将涉及 15 亿美元注资
item.description: 巴西 Gol 航空公司在周一提交的一份证券文件中表示，该公司预计将通过发行新股和对 20 亿美元债务进行再融资的方式，向破产保护程序注资 15 亿美元。【原文：Brazilian airline Gol expects its exit of Chapter 11 bankruptcy proceedings to involve a $1.5 billion capital injection through the issuance of new shares and the refinancing of $2 billion in debt, it said in a securities filing on Monday.】

item.title: 标普全球：中国刺激房地产政策引发小城市银行风险
item.description: S&P Global 公司周一表示，中国为重振陷入困境的房地产市场而采取的最新措施可能会给在低线城市开展业务的银行带来风险。【原文：China's latest steps to revive its struggling property market could pose risks to banks operating in lower-tier cities, S&P Global said on Monday.】

item.title: 数据显示，巴西超过比利时成为中国电动汽车和混合动力汽车的最大出口市场
item.description: 行业数据显示，巴西已取代比利时成为中国新能源汽车的最大出口市场，因为在欧盟对中国电动汽车进行反补贴调查之际，中国汽车制造商增加了对非欧洲市场的销售。【原文：Brazil has overtaken Belgium as the largest export market for Chinese new energy vehicles, industry data showed, as Chinese carmakers increase sales to non-European markets amid European Union's anti-subsidy probe into Chinese electric vehicles.】

item.title: 中国万科以亏损底价出售深圳地块
item.description: 周一提交的一份文件显示，资金短缺的中国万科通过拍卖以 22.4 亿元人民币（3.0918 亿美元）的价格出售了深圳的一块地皮，这比它近七年前购买同一块 1.9 万平方米地皮的价格低了 27% 以上。【原文：Cash-strapped China Vanke has sold a Shenzhen land plot via auction for 2.24 billion yuan ($309.18 million), a filing on Monday showed, more than 27% below the price it paid for the same 19,000 square-metre block nearly seven years ago.】

item.title: 印尼调查涉嫌违反竞争规则的 Shopee 和 Lazada 分公司
item.description: 印度尼西亚反垄断机构周一表示，它正在调查电子商务平台 Shopee 和 Lazada 在当地的分支机构，因为它们涉嫌违反反竞争规则。【原文：Indonesia's anti-trust agency said on Monday it is investigating the local units of e-commerce platforms Shopee and Lazada for suspected violations of anti-competition rules.】

item.title: 日本在月度报告中上调工厂产出预期
item.description: 日本政府在其月度经济报告中称，工厂产出出现回升迹象，表明生产可能已经触底，这是日本政府一年来首次上调对工厂产出的评估。【原文：Japan's government upgraded its assessment of factory output for the first time in a year, saying in its monthly economic report that it showed signs of picking up and signalling production may have bottomed out.】

item.title: 德国 5 月商业景气指数停滞不前
item.description: 周一的一项调查显示，德国 5 月份的商业士气停滞不前，没有达到预期的改善幅度，也止步于连续三个月的增长。【原文：German business morale stagnated in May, a survey showed on Monday, falling short of a forecast improvement and putting a stop to three consecutive months of increases.】

item.title: 消息人士称，Stellantis 将宣布在意大利生产混合动力版 500 电动车
item.description: 两位熟悉内情的消息人士称，菲亚特所有者 Stellantis 预计将于周一宣布在其意大利 Mirafiori 工厂生产混合动力版 500e 小型电动汽车，这证实了《欧洲汽车新闻》的报道。【原文：Fiat owner Stellantis is expected to announce on Monday a hybrid version of its 500e small electric car to be produced at its Mirafiori plant in Italy, two sources familiar with the matter said, confirming a report by Automotive News Europe.】

item.title: 阿里巴巴旗下阿里速卖通招募贝克汉姆，以 "提高 "全球销售额
item.description: 中国巨头阿里巴巴旗下的电子商务网站阿里速卖通（AliExpress）已签约前英格兰足球队队长大卫-贝克汉姆（David Beckham）担任品牌大使，在向全球销售廉价中国制造商品的竞争中迎头赶上竞争对手 PDD Holdings 旗下的特姆公司（Temu）。【原文：AliExpress, an e-commerce site owned by Chinese giant Alibaba, has signed former England soccer captain David Beckham as a brand ambassador as it plays catch-up with rival PDD Holdings' Temu in a battle to sell cheap made-in-China goods to the world.】

item.title: 法国期待难以捉摸的欧盟资本市场解决创业资金问题
item.description: 部长们、首席执行官们和投资者们表示，法国正寄希望于新一轮推动欧盟分散资本市场的整合，使其具备必要的规模，从而使蓬勃发展的初创企业部门摆脱美国风险投资的主导地位。【原文：France is banking on a new push to integrate the European Union's fragmented capital markets to give them the scale needed to wean its flourishing startup sector off of dominant U.S. venture capital, ministers, CEOs and investors said.】

item.title: 埃隆-马斯克的 xAI 获得 60 亿美元新融资
item.description: 埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）的人工智能初创公司xAI周日在一篇博客文章中表示，该公司已在B轮融资中筹集到60亿美元，投资者包括安德森-霍洛维茨（Andreessen Horowitz）和红杉资本（Sequoia Capital）等。【原文：Elon Musk's artificial intelligence startup xAI has raised $6 billion in a Series B funding round backed by investors including Andreessen Horowitz and Sequoia Capital among others, the company said in a blog post on Sunday.】

item.title: 据英国《金融时报》报道，瑞银排除了埃尔莫蒂首席执行官外部继任者的可能性
item.description: 据英国《金融时报》周一报道，瑞银集团已排除了任命外部人士接任首席执行官塞尔吉奥-埃尔莫蒂的可能性，并计划在他大约三年后卸任时，从三位内部候选人的候选名单中做出选择。【原文：UBS has ruled out appointing an outsider as the successor to CEO Sergio Ermotti, and plans to choose from a shortlist of three internal candidates when he steps down in about three years, the Financial Times reported on Monday.】

item.title: 清算人达成股权出售协议后，中国恒大电动汽车部门股价大涨
item.description: 中国恒大新能源汽车集团称，清算人已代表主要股东同意出售这家电动汽车（EV）制造商的股份，该公司股价周一恢复交易后上涨了一倍多。【原文：Shares of China Evergrande New Energy Vehicle Group more than doubled on Monday as trade resumed after the company said liquidators had agreed on behalf of key shareholders to sell a stake in the electric vehicle (EV) maker.】

item.title: 在中国，星巴克试图避免价格战，但却被卷入打折大战
item.description: 星巴克在中国面临着来自快速增长的低成本竞争对手的激烈竞争，这些竞争对手已经蚕食了星巴克在中国的市场份额，星巴克正日益被拖入一场价格战，星巴克表示希望避免这场价格战。【原文：As Starbucks faces stiff competition for its brew in China from fast-growing, low-cost rivals who have chipped into its market share, the coffee chain is increasingly being dragged into a price war it says it wants to avoid.】

item.title: 中国设立 475 亿美元国家基金促进半导体产业发展
item.description: 中国成立了一个新的国家支持的投资基金，注册资本为 3,440 亿元人民币（475 亿美元），以促进中国半导体产业的发展。【原文：China has set up a new state-backed investment fund with registered capital of 344 billion yuan ($47.5 billion) to boost the country's semiconductor industry.】

item.title: 中国的 "资产饥荒 "抑制了央行的债券交易雄心
item.description: 中国金融部门缺乏低风险资产，这阻碍了中国央行在中断 17 年后重返国债市场，从而提高其货币政策工具箱效率的计划。【原文：A scarcity of low-risk assets in China's financial sector is obstructing the central bank's plans to make its monetary policy toolkit more efficient with a return to the treasury bond market after a 17-year hiatus.】

item.title: 中国房地产开发商凯撒清算听证会延期
item.description: 周一，香港一家法院将寻求对凯萨集团进行清算的请愿聆讯延期至 6 月 24 日，使这家陷入困境的中国开发商在制定债务重组计划时得到一些喘息机会。【原文：A Hong Kong court on Monday adjourned a hearing on a petition seeking the liquidation of Kaisa Group until June 24, giving the embattled Chinese developer some respite as it works on its debt restructuring plan.】

item.title: 中国 1-4 月工业利润增长 4.3%，与一季度持平
item.description: 周一的官方数据显示，中国工业企业前四个月的利润同比增长了 4.3%。【原文：Profits at China's industrial firms rose 4.3% in the first four months from the same period last year, official data showed on Monday.】

item.title: 全球通胀数据公布前美元坚挺
item.description: 本周伊始，美元走势平稳，投资者重点关注美国、欧洲和日本的通胀数据，以便为全球利率前景提供指导。【原文：The dollar made a steady start to the week, as investors were focused on U.S., European and Japanese inflation data to guide the global interest rate outlook.】

item.title: 市场期待欧佩克+会议，油价变化不大
item.description: 周一亚市早盘，油价处于持稳状态，市场在等待6月2日举行的欧佩克+会议，预计产油国将在会上讨论今年剩余时间维持自愿减产的问题。【原文：Oil prices were in a holding pattern in early Asian trading on Monday as markets awaited an OPEC+ meeting on June 2 where producers are expected to discuss maintaining voluntary output cuts for the rest of the year.】

item.title: 上田表示日本央行将谨慎推进通胀目标框架
item.description: 日本央行（BOJ）行长上田一夫（Kazuo Ueda）周一表示，日本央行将谨慎推进通胀目标框架，并指出在多年的超宽松货币政策之后，日本面临着一些 "独特的困难"。【原文：The Bank of Japan (BOJ) will proceed cautiously with inflation-targeting frameworks, Governor Kazuo Ueda said on Monday, noting that some challenges are "uniquely difficult" for Japan after years of ultra-easy monetary policy.】

item.title: 通胀测试前亚洲股市寸步难行
item.description: 亚洲股市周一走高，因为投资者正在为本周繁忙的数据做准备，最终将公布一份关键的美国通胀报告，该报告可能为美国降息创造条件，尽管降息还需要几个月的时间。【原文：Asian shares edged higher on Monday as investors braced for a busy week of data which culminates in a key U.S. inflation report that could set the stage for a cut in interest rates there, albeit not for a few months yet.】
